definition: no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to escape/to run away/to flee

sentences.english: Product such as not escape, cannot jump high walls, the legs are hot coals burns.
sentences.chinese: 品如无路可逃，无法跳下高墙，腿被炙热的炭火烧伤。

sentences.english: By small hills, float and handsome XingShuYuan not escape, be forced to roll down the slope.
sentences.chinese: 到了小山林，帅飘和邢书媛无路可逃，被逼滚下山坡。

sentences.english: Devil, you have no way to run today.
sentences.chinese: 国贼，今日你再无路可逃。

sentences.english: Jack: What could've happened to this girl to make her feel she had no way out?
sentences.chinese: 这个女孩到底是出了什么事，为何会觉得无路可逃？

sentences.english: I ain't got no way to run, all those shit manke me so mad.
sentences.chinese: 我无路可逃了，所有这些破事儿都让人愤怒。

sentences.english: We were two miles offshore. There was no way off .
sentences.chinese: 我们在离岸两英里远的地方，无路可逃。

sentences.english: Locked in the room, he had no way to escape.
sentences.chinese: 他被锁在屋里，无路可逃。

definition: lit. there is no road to the sky, nor door into the earth (idiom)/fig. to be at the end of one's rope/to be trapped in a hopeless situation
pinyin: shang4 tian1 wu2 lu4 , ru4 di4 wu2 men2

definition: lit. even given wings, you couldn't fly (idiom); fig. impossible to escape
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
nowhere to go/at the end of one's tether
lit. like a turtle in a jar/to be trapped (idiom)
to escape without trace (idiom); to make one's getaway (from the scene of a crime)/to show a clean pair of heels
to run away/to escape
to walk right into the trap
to escape/to flee/to run away
to flee from sth/to run away/to escape
to escape/to run away/to flee
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
to be at an impasse (idiom)/in a tight spot/at the end of one's rope/desperate
to flee in disorder/to scurry off
to run away/to flee in disarray
inescapable net (idiom)/trap/dragnet
